intro: Eriogonum biumbellatum, commonly known as the twin-leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. Eriogonum biumbellatum is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
